title: Industrial Designer, Onsite Support
location: New Taipei, Banqiao District, New Taipei City, Taiwan
description:
In this role, you will be responsible for onsite part-level and device reviews to ensure they meet the quality standards set by the Industrial Design (ID) team. Additionally, you will lead the design of sustaining design projects working closely with the ID team.

You will be part of a team of designers and Color, Material and Finishing (CMF) experts working closely with engineering, quality, and supply chain to deliver the best of Google through our devices.
Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.
key_qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Industrial Design, or equivalent practical experience.
6 years of experience working in product design.
Experience in assessing cosmetic quality across a variety of materials and finishes.
Experience in communicating quality assessment to suppliers and developing plans for improvements.
preferred_qualifications:
Experience in Color, Material, and Finishing (CMF) development and execution.
Experience in collaborating with US based design teams.
Knowledge of technical and manufacturing.
Ability to work separately while taking direction from team members in other regions.
Ability to travel throughout Asia and the United States when needed.
responsibilities:
Conduct onsite supplier visits as a member of the Industrial Design team and communicate with suppliers to achieve quality standards.
Review parts for cosmetic quality throughout development to ensure they meet the standards established by the Industrial Design team.
Review fully-assembled devices to assess build quality, fit and finish, and step and gap.
Drive the design of accessories and sustaining products working closely with ID team based in Mountain View, CA.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members including CMF, engineering, quality, and supply chain.
